This antenna is a simply and very useful extension of the network. I am able to wirelessly extend my network even in deep caves and through walls.
The range of an antenna depends on the number of connected metal blocks and the number of metal blocks of the receiving antenna.
I noticed that I have to send signals over great distances. If I had to use network cables for this I would need a vast amount of resources.

Which is why I developed a laser that is capable of transmitting signals over a distance of 1024 meters. Since I have also to be able to respond in a network transmitter and receiver are integrated in one block.
Originally I wanted to use ultra violet light for the data transfer but the atmospheric deflection was too great and I had to use infrared light.
For the laser to work (also over long distances) transmitter and receiver have to be exactly on one line.
